page.title: 06SHROPSHIRE HEDGEROWS.
page.content: During the survey period of June and July 1985 whilst travelling round the area we found the hedgerows, although containing many colourful plants, were a positive hazzard to road users in the lanes.This was because many brambles and large plants stuck out into the road and blocked the view round the corners. We understand from the people in the area that in the past The Council always came round to cut the hedges, but they have had to save so much money that hedge cutting is one of the thing that has suffered. Farmers would do it but at this time of year they are so busy with the silage making that they cannot spare the time.Also it ties up a tractor for two or three days when it could be used on the farm.
